sentences.baseForm: I eat lunch at 1 PM every day.
sentences.pastSimple: Yesterday, I ate a delicious pizza.
sentences.pastParticiple: He had already eaten when I arrived.
sentences.presentParticiple: She is eating an apple right now.

sentences.baseForm: I go to school by bus.
sentences.pastSimple: They went to the park yesterday.
sentences.pastParticiple: He had already gone home when I called.
sentences.presentParticiple: We are going on a trip this weekend.

sentences.baseForm: I read books in my free time.
sentences.pastSimple: She read a great novel last night.
sentences.pastParticiple: They have already read the entire series.
sentences.presentParticiple: He is currently reading a magazine.

sentences.baseForm: I write letters to my friends.
sentences.pastSimple: She wrote a beautiful poem yesterday.
sentences.pastParticiple: The report has been written by the team.
sentences.presentParticiple: He is writing an important email now.

sentences.baseForm: I run in the park every morning.
sentences.pastSimple: He ran a marathon last year.
sentences.pastParticiple: They have run this race many times.
sentences.presentParticiple: She is running fast to catch the bus.

sentences.baseForm: I sleep for 8 hours every night.
sentences.pastSimple: She slept soundly after a long day.
sentences.pastParticiple: I had slept for only a few hours.
sentences.presentParticiple: He is sleeping on the couch.

sentences.baseForm: I drink water throughout the day.
sentences.pastSimple: She drank a glass of juice this morning.
sentences.pastParticiple: They had drunk all the coffee by the time I got there.
sentences.presentParticiple: He is drinking a cup of tea now.

sentences.baseForm: I sing songs in the shower.
sentences.pastSimple: She sang a beautiful melody at the concert.
sentences.pastParticiple: They have sung this song many times.
sentences.presentParticiple: He is singing along with the music.

sentences.baseForm: I speak English fluently.
sentences.pastSimple: She spoke with confidence during the presentation.
sentences.pastParticiple: They had already spoken to the manager.
sentences.presentParticiple: He is speaking on the phone right now.

sentences.baseForm: I dance to my favorite music.
sentences.pastSimple: She danced gracefully at the party last night.
sentences.pastParticiple: They had danced for hours at the wedding.
sentences.presentParticiple: He is dancing to the rhythm of the song.

sentences.baseForm: She accepts the offer graciously.
sentences.pastSimple: He accepted the invitation to the party.
sentences.pastParticiple: They had already accepted the terms of the contract.
sentences.presentParticiple: I am accepting the responsibility for the project.

sentences.baseForm: They arrive at the airport on time.
sentences.pastSimple: She arrived at the meeting a little late.
sentences.pastParticiple: I had already arrived when the event started.
sentences.presentParticiple: He is arriving in the evening.

sentences.baseForm: We breathe to stay alive.
sentences.pastSimple: He breathed deeply to calm himself.
sentences.pastParticiple: She had breathed the fresh air of the mountains.
sentences.presentParticiple: I am breathing slowly to relax.

sentences.baseForm: Artists create beautiful paintings.
sentences.pastSimple: He created a unique sculpture for the exhibition.
sentences.pastParticiple: They had created a masterpiece of literature.
sentences.presentParticiple: She is creating a new website.

sentences.baseForm: We decide on the best course of action.
sentences.pastSimple: She decided to take a vacation this summer.
sentences.pastParticiple: He had already decided on the menu for the party.
sentences.presentParticiple: I am deciding between two options.

sentences.baseForm: Parents encourage their children to do their best.
sentences.pastSimple: She encouraged her friend to pursue her dreams.
sentences.pastParticiple: They had encouraged me to take the opportunity.
sentences.presentParticiple: He is encouraging his team to work harder.

sentences.baseForm: Leaves fall from the trees in autumn.
sentences.pastSimple: She fell and scraped her knee while running.
sentences.pastParticiple: I had fallen asleep by the time they arrived.
sentences.presentParticiple: He is falling in love.

sentences.baseForm: Plants grow when they receive sunlight and water.
sentences.pastSimple: He grew taller over the summer.
sentences.pastParticiple: They had grown their own vegetables in the garden.
sentences.presentParticiple: She is growing her business successfully.

sentences.baseForm: Friends help each other in times of need.
sentences.pastSimple: She helped her neighbor carry groceries.
sentences.pastParticiple: They had helped me with my project.
sentences.presentParticiple: I am helping my sister with her homework.

sentences.baseForm: Continuous practice can improve your skills.
sentences.pastSimple: She improved her grades with hard work.
sentences.pastParticiple: He had improved the performance of the computer.
sentences.presentParticiple: They are improving the company's processes.
